definition: Fan Li (536-488 BC), politician of Yue state, businessman and economist
surname Fan
pattern/model/example
calabash
wood-boring insect

sentences.english: The King of Yue, Gou Jian submitted and sued for peace.
sentences.chinese: 后越王勾践卧薪尝胆，任用文种和范蠡重振国政。

sentences.english: Now please have a visit at the Fan Li Cultural Museum.
sentences.chinese: 下面请大家参观范蠡文化陈列馆。

sentences.english: Fan Li and Aristotle are respectively politicians in ancient Chinaand Greece.
sentences.chinese: 范蠡和亚里士多德是古代中国和古希腊的两大政治家。

sentences.english: During the Spring and Autumn Period(770-476BC), there were two famous senior officials in the State of Yue.
sentences.chinese: 范蠡和文仲是春秋时期越国的两个大官。

sentences.english: This is a place where Fan Li practiced with his sword after his retirement.
sentences.chinese: 这里是范蠡隐居后经常舞剑的地方。

sentences.english: Here is the Pottery Workshop of Fan Li.
This place, named the Holy Scenic Area of Tao Zu, is also a best memory of Fan Li.
sentences.chinese: 我们这里名为“陶祖圣境”就是对范蠡最好的纪念。

sentences.english: " Saint" Fan Li once said a word we can taste of.
sentences.chinese: “商圣”范蠡曾经说过一句话我们可以来品味下。

sentences.english: Fan Li was the pioneer and practitioner of the culture of scholar merchant.
sentences.chinese: 范蠡是我国儒商文化的开拓者和实践家。

sentences.english: After his retirement from the official circle, where did Fan Li go?
sentences.chinese: 范蠡隐退官场之后到哪里去了呢？

sentences.english: This is the well-known Fan Li Lake of Jiaxing.
sentences.chinese: 这里就是嘉兴有名的范蠡湖。

sentences.english: Fang Li as a historical figure should not be forgotten.
sentences.chinese: 范蠡是不该被遗忘的历史人物。

sentences.english: But Fan Li not only did it but also did it differently.
sentences.chinese: 但范蠡不仅这样做了，而且做得与众不同。

definition: King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Wu Zixu (-484 BC), powerful politician in Wu/famous as destitute refugee begging in Wu town, cf 吳市吹簫|吴市吹箫
King Gou Jian of Yue (c. 470 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Guan Zhong (-645 BC), famous politician of Qi 齊國|齐国 of Spring and Autumn period/known as Guangzi 管子
a restricted view through a bamboo tube
Wen Zhong (-467 BC), adviser to the state of Yue during Spring and Autumn period
King Helu of Wu (-496 BC, reigned 514-496 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸/also called 吳王闔廬|吴王阖庐
Zhang Yi (-309 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
Duke Huan of Qi (reigned 685-643 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
King Helu of Wu (-496 BC, reigned 514-496 BC)/also called 闔廬|阖庐
Yue state/generic term for states in south China or southeast Asia at different historical periods
Wu state (in south China, in different historical periods)/Wu state 220-280, founded by Sun Quan 孫權|孙权 the southernmost of the three Kingdoms
Duke Wen of Jin (697-628 BC, reigned 636-628 BC), one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸
Lord Menchang of Qi, Chancellor of Qi and of Wei during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
Duke Mu of Qin, the first substantial king of Qin (ruled 659-621 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸

Xishi (c. 450 BC), famous Chinese beauty, foremost of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3], given by King Gou Jian 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4] of Yue as concubine to King of Wu as part of a successful plan to destroy Wu
Su Qin (340-284 BC), political strategist of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
